Posts.Content: I really appreciate you sharing your story with me. It really got to me. I couldn't even finish it the first time. I needed to get kleenex. I lost my mom to pancratic cancer and we too were best friends, and yes laughter is a MUST! I would love to know your name and age because I would love to publish this in my book. My regular email address is bnstacy@aol.com. I wish you all the best and you inspire me... you're a very couragous woman. Is it my understanding that your husband is sick too?? Or did I misunderstand? Stacy
Posts.Title: Help! my Mom Was Diagnosed With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Can i get your story? Thanks so much.....

Posts.Title: Help! my Mom Was Diagnosed With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I have breast cancer. I am looking for stories from the children (adult or minors) whose mom was diagnosed with breast cancer. I want to hear about your own journey and feelings. I am looking to publish a book for children/by children. I couldn't find anything like this for my own children. I really think a book like this would've helped them. It helps to know YOU (the child) are not going through this alone. --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ---- Stacy
Posts.Title: Help! my Mom Was Diagnosed With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I'm not a psychologist just a survivor, it sounds to me like that's just your mom's way of dealing with her breast cancer. I made fun of my cancer (stage 3) you know, put me in front of the line "I have breast cancer" things like that. It's very tramatic, more than anyone other than the person can believe. I'm sure your mom will calm down. I'd love to hear more from you, i'm trying to compose a book of stories from the child/children on how they are dealing with the diagnosis of their parent having cancer. I think it would help a lot of other children to know that they are not alone in their feelings. Any interest? If yes, email me directly to --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ---- and in the "message" box put "Cancer story" include your age now and when your mom got diagnosed, feelings, guilt, anger (even at your mom's behavior) See if my book was out, you'd know if anyone else's mom did what your mom is doing. That is my purpose for my book. Do you think you can help? Thanks a lot, Stacy And good luck
Posts.Title: Help! my Mom Was Diagnosed With Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I have breast cancer. I am looking for stories from the children (adult or minors) whose mom was diagnosed with breast cancer. I want to hear about your own journey and feelings. I am looking to publish a book for children/by children. I couldn't find anything like this for my own children. I really think a book like this would've helped them. It helps to know YOU (the child) are not going through this alone. Please email me your stories to bnstacy@aol.com. I need your name and your age of diagnosis and age now. Stacy
